        public FileStructure insertRegularFile(FilePath path)
                                throws FileStructureException,
                                       FileFlowWarning
        Traverse through the path and touch the file at the end of the path. The path to the file must exist.
        Parameters:
        path - The path to the file to be touched
        Returns:
        the file structure that was created
        Throws:
        FileStructureException
        FileFlowWarning

      • copyFileToPath

        public FileStructure copyFileToPath(FilePath sourcePath,
                                    FilePath destinationPath)
                             throws FileStructureException
        Copies a file denoted by a file path to another location in the directory structure. Consider the following cases:

        -> file1 to file2: If file2 exists it will be overwritten; else it will be created

        -> file1 to dir2: file1 will be copied into dir2 overwriting file1 in dir2 if it exists

        -> dir1 to dir2: a copy of dir1 will be created in dir2. if dir2/dir1 happens to exist, contents will be merged overwriting the existing

        -> dir1 to file2: cp: cannot overwrite non-directory 'file2' with directory 'dir1'

        -> file1 to non-existing: cp: cannot create regular file 'dir1/file1': No such file or directory

        -> dir1 to non-existing: cp: cannot create directory 'dir2/dir1': No such file or directory

        Parameters:
        sourcePath - The path pointing to the source file to copy
        destinationPath - The path pointing to the destination location
        Returns:
        the new file structure that was created
        Throws:
        FileStructureException

      • merge

        public FileStructure merge(FileStructure source)
        Merge two files structures together. All files under the invoking file structure will be overwritten by the files under the file structure that is passed in. Note that a clone of source will be merged so source will not be modified.
        Parameters:
        source - The file structure to merge into the invoking file structure. The files under this will overwrite any files under the invoking file structure.
        Returns:
        a new FileStructure object with both file structures merged

      • abstractMerge

        public static FileStructure abstractMerge(FileStructure fs1,
                                          FileStructure fs2)
        Merges two file structures together creating making differences as optional nodes resulting in an abstract file structure. Both file structure parameters will not be modified
        Parameters:
        fs1 - The file structure to merge with fs2
        fs2 - The file structure to merge with fs1
        Returns:
        the merged file structure

      • getAllFilePaths

        public java.util.ArrayList<FilePath> getAllFilePaths(boolean inclusive)
        If the file is a directory then the paths of all files under the directory will be returned. If it is a regular file then its name will be returned
        Parameters:
        inclusive - true if the invoking file structure should be included in the file path
        Returns:
        an ArrayList of all file paths under this file

      • getAbsolutePath

        public FilePath getAbsolutePath()
        Gives the full path to this file. The file path returned does not include a preceding file separator. ex: file1 will return 'root/file1' and not '/root/file1'
        Returns:
        the full path to this file

      • mergeImpl

        private FileStructure mergeImpl(FileStructure source)
        Merge two files structures together. All files under the invoking file structure will be overwritten by the files under the file structure that is passed in. Source will be modified using this method. See merge(FileStructure source) to avoid making changes to source.
        Parameters:
        source - The file structure to merge into the invoking file structure. The files under this will overwrite any files under the invoking file structure.
        Returns:
        the original file structure merged with the fs
